item.title: W.B. add a quote by Ingrid Bergman
item.description: "Happiness is good health and a bad memory." -- Ingrid Bergman

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Marie Antoinette
item.description: "But how will I eat cake if my head is over there, and my hands are over here?" -- Marie Antoinette

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Angelica Huston as Morticia Addams
item.description: "You have taken Fester and turned him into your personal love slave. I respect that. But Debbie (gesturing at the decor around her)...PASTELS?" -- Angelica Huston as Morticia Addams

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Carrie King
item.description: "Words once uttered, cannot be buttered, so season them all before you speak" -- Carrie King

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Frank O'Hara
item.description: "My eyes are vague blue, like the sky, and change all the time; they are indiscriminate but fleeting, entirely specific and disloyal, so that no one trusts me. I am always looking away. Or again at something after it has given me up." -- Frank O'Hara

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "I stick my finger into existence and it smells of nothing." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Laura Moriarty
item.description: "One way to remain unfinished is to stop. the other is to go on." -- Laura Moriarty

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Juliet Cook
item.description: "I once typed 'vagina dentata' into dictionary.com and it asked me, 'Did you mean giant anteater?" -- Juliet Cook

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Ginnetta Correli
item.description: "Father son oily ghost amen." -- Ginnetta Correli

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Ed Wood
item.description: "You're the ruler of the universe. Try to show a little taste!" -- Ed Wood

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Kathy Acker
item.description: "...'cause humans, above all, fear intelligence. how humans, scared out of their minds, gather whatever intelligence they can put their hands on and put it all in a central penitentiary named facts..." -- Kathy Acker

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "It never got weird enough for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Frank O'Hara
item.description: "After the first glass of vodka you can accept just about anything of life even your own mysteriousness you think it is nice that a box of matches is purple and brown and is called La Petite and comes from Sweden for they are words that you know and that is all you know words not their feelings or what they mean and you write because you know them not because you understand them because you don't you are stupid and lazy and will never be great but you do what you know because what else is there?" -- Frank O'Hara

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Christopher Hampton
item.description: "The only unbearable thing is that nothing is unbearable." -- Christopher Hampton

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "Quentin Crisp (to handsome young man on the street): "What's the matter, sexy? Don't you like dehydrated fruit?" -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Else Lasker-Schüler
item.description: "A true poet does not say 'azure'; a true poet says 'blue." -- Else Lasker-Schüler

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "I have always wanted to write a book that ended with the word 'mayonnaise." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Jenny Holzer
item.description: "SPIT ALL OVER SOMEONE WITH A MOUTHFUL OF MILK IF YOU WANT TO FIND OUT SOMETHING ABOUT THEIR PERSONALITY FAST." -- Jenny Holzer

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "You are a beautiful person, Doctor. Clearheaded. Strong. But you seem always to be dragging your heart along the ground. From now on, little by little, you must prepare yourself to face death. If you devote all of your future energy to living, you will not be able to die well. You must begin to shift gears, a little at a time. Living and dying are, in a sense, of equal value."--Nimit in "Thailand" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: W.B. add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Great art is horseshit, buy tacos." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: W.B. add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A First Sign of the Beginning of Understanding is the Wish to Die." -- Franz Kafka
